title: Personal complaint #1: Even though there are people around me, I feel lonely.
contentSnippet: Recently, I've been feeling frustrated due to a lot of negative things happening. It's been affecting me to the point where I've been venting my complaints to others, and I'm afraid that if I keep doing this, I'll end up being disliked. So, maybe I should write down my complaints. I'll probably write some really terrible things, but it would be nice if someone could empathize with me. Being alone is scary. Warning: This text may hurt someone's feelings. Please read it at your own discretion. Also, please don't share it with my parents. If you do, I won't impose any punishment... but I'll cry. That's all. Let's continue reading.

title: Translation: As a 3rd grader, I no longer wanted to go to school.
contentSnippet: If you forget something, the homeroom teacher will make you play a "punishment game". If you're bad at playing the recorder, the music teacher will shout at you loudly during detention. It's nothing if it were now, but when I was in elementary school, it was very scary for me. Every time I made a weird mistake, the class would fall silent and I would be looked at with disdain. Even if someone tried to support me, they would also be looked at with disdain. From the first and second grades of elementary school, where everyone is friends, to the day when we become "who is the good student," in the third grade, I didn't want to go to school anymore. I go to school today. I'm filled with anxiety that I might get scolded again. I arrive at the nearest station to the school. The three-minute walk of about 200 meters feels heavy.

title: [ATO2] List of Most Important Cities in the Early Stages (Updating)
contentSnippet: I have created a list of cities that should be considered in the early stages. Please take a look if you would like. I have categorized them into six regions: Asia, Middle East, Europe, North and South America, Africa, and Australia. I will also include information on the economic size of each city (combining business and tourism levels). I will list them in the order that they should be considered (including places with less competition and easier battles), but please note that there may be exceptions. Continue reading Asia.

title: If I had a lot of money, what would I do?
contentSnippet: If I had money, I thought I would be able to do all sorts of things. But that was just a fantasy, because in reality, when I buy services or products with money, I'm really happy at first, but after about three days, I lose interest. Is having a lot of money really happiness? Read more.
